meanings.definition: The state or quality of being binding.
meanings.sent1: The bindingnesses of the contract ensured both parties followed the agreement.
meanings.sent2: The legal document's bindingnesses made it enforceable in court.
meanings.sent3: The bindingnesses of the rulebook were so strict, even the principal had to follow them.
meanings.sent4: Her promise had the bindingnesses of a steel chain, unbreakable and secure.
meanings.sent5: The bindingnesses of the oath weighed heavily on his conscience, reminding him of his commitment.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is binding.
meanings.sent1: The bindingnesses of the agreement were questioned due to its vague terms.
meanings.sent2: The bindingnesses of the law varied depending on the jurisdiction.
meanings.sent3: The bindingnesses of the bedtime curfew seemed to magically disappear when his favorite show was on.
meanings.sent4: The bindingnesses of tradition held strong, like roots anchoring a tree in place.
meanings.sent5: The bindingnesses of the promise felt like chains, restricting his freedom to act as he pleased.

meanings.sent1: The bindingnesses of the decision left no room for negotiation.
meanings.sent2: The bindingnesses of the contract were clearly outlined to avoid any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The bindingnesses of the new rule seemed to have a mind of its own, enforcing itself without fail.
meanings.sent4: The bindingnesses of tradition held the community together like a strong adhesive.
meanings.sent5: The bindingnesses of the promise echoed in his mind, a constant reminder of his commitment.
